Project¶

customers_db.py¶

This module handles all customer-related operations, such as registration, wallet management, and updates.

Customers.customers_db.charge_customer_wallet(username, amount)[source]¶

Charges a customer’s wallet by adding a specified amount.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the customer.

  • amount (float) – The amount to add to the wallet.

Returns:

True if successful, False if the customer is not found or an error occurs.

Return type:

bool

Customers.customers_db.create_customers_table()[source]¶

Create the Customers table if it does not exist.

Customers.customers_db.deduct_customer_wallet(username, amount)[source]¶

Deducts a specified amount from a customer’s wallet.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the customer.

  • amount (float) – The amount to deduct from the wallet.

Returns:

True if successful, False if the customer is not found, insufficient balance, or an error occurs.

Return type:

bool

Deletes a customer by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer to delete.

Returns:

True if the customer was deleted, False if no customer was found.

Return type:

bool

Retrieves a customer by their username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The unique username of the customer.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the customer’s details, or None if not found.

Return type:

dict

Customers.customers_db.get_customer_wallet(username)[source]¶

Retrieves the wallet balance of a customer by their username.

Parameters:

username (str) – The unique username of the customer.

Returns:

The wallet balance of the customer, or None if the customer is not found.

Return type:

float

Customers.customers_db.register_customer(customer)[source]¶

Registers a new customer in the Customers table.

Parameters:

customer (dict) – A dictionary containing customer details.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the inserted customer’s details, or an empty dictionary if an error occurred.

Return type:

dict

Customers.customers_db.update_customer(username, updates)[source]¶

Updates one or more fields of a customer by username.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the customer to update.

  • updates (dict) – A dictionary containing the fields to update and their new values.

Returns:

True if the customer was updated, False if no customer was found.

Return type:

bool

inventory_db.py¶

This module manages inventory operations, including adding, updating, and deducting stock, retrieving product details, and ensuring data consistency.

Inventory.inventory_db.add_goods(goods)[source]¶

Add a new item to the inventory.

Parameters:

goods (dict) – A dictionary containing the item’s details, including: - name (str): Name of the item. - category (str): Category of the item. - price_per_item (float): Price per unit of the item. - description (str): Description of the item. - stock_count (int): Quantity available in stock.

Returns:

The newly added item’s details, or an empty dictionary if an error occurs.

Return type:

dict

Inventory.inventory_db.connect_to_db()[source]¶

Connect to the SQLite database.

Returns:

The connection object to the SQLite database.

Return type:

sqlite3.Connection

Inventory.inventory_db.create_inventory_table()[source]¶

Create the Inventory table if it does not exist.

The table stores the following fields:

  • id: Unique identifier for each item.

  • name: Name of the item.

  • category: Category of the item (‘food’, ‘clothes’, ‘accessories’, ‘electronics’).

  • price_per_item: Price per unit of the item.

  • description: Additional information about the item.

  • stock_count: The quantity of the item available in stock.

Inventory.inventory_db.deduct_goods(name, category, quantity)[source]¶

Deduct a specified quantity from an item’s stock.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the item.

  • category (str) – The category of the item.

  • quantity (int) – The quantity to deduct.

Returns:

The updated item’s details if successful, or an error message if not.

Return type:

dict

Inventory.inventory_db.get_all_goods()[source]¶

Retrieve all items in the inventory.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries, each representing an item.

Return type:

list

Inventory.inventory_db.get_good_by_name_and_category(name, category)[source]¶

Retrieve a specific good by name and category.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the good.

  • category (str) – The category of the good.

Returns:

A dictionary representing the item if found, or an error message.

Return type:

dict

Update the details of an item in the inventory.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the item.

  • category (str) – The category of the item.

  • updates (dict) – A dictionary of fields to update and their new values.

Returns:

The updated item’s details if successful, or an error message if not.

reviews_db.py¶

This module manages customer reviews, including submitting, updating, deleting, moderating reviews, and retrieving review details.

Reviews.reviews_db.connect_to_db()[source]¶

Connect to the SQLite database.

Returns:

A connection object to interact with the database.

Return type:

sqlite3.Connection

Reviews.reviews_db.create_reviews_table()[source]¶

Create the Reviews table if it does not exist.

The table stores product reviews, including product name, username, rating, and comments.

Reviews.reviews_db.delete_review(review_id)[source]¶

Delete a review by ID.

Parameters:

review_id (int) – The ID of the review to delete.

Returns:

A success message or an error message.

Return type:

dict

Parameters:

username (str) – The username of the customer.

Returns:

A list of reviews or an error message.

Return type:

list

Reviews.reviews_db.moderate_review(review_id, moderated)[source]¶

Moderate a review by updating its status.

Parameters:

  • review_id (int) – The ID of the review to moderate.

  • moderated (bool) – The moderation status (True for approved, False for flagged).

Returns:

A success message or an error message.

Return type:

dict

Reviews.reviews_db.submit_review(product_name, username, rating, comment)[source]¶

Submit a new review for a product.

Parameters:

  • product_name (str) – The name of the product.

  • username (str) – The username of the reviewer.

  • rating (int) – The rating given to the product (1-5).

  • comment (str) – The review comment.

Returns:

A success message or an error message.

Return type:

dict

Reviews.reviews_db.update_review(review_id, rating, comment)[source]¶

Update an existing review.

Parameters:

  • review_id (int) – The ID of the review to update.

  • rating (int) – The updated rating (1-5).

  • comment (str) – The updated comment.

Returns:

A success message or an error message.

Return type:

dict

Reviews.reviews_db.validate_review_input(rating)[source]¶

Validate the rating value.

Parameters:

rating (int) – The rating value to validate.

Raises:

ValueError – If the rating is not between 1 and 5.

sales_db.py¶

This module tracks sales operations, manages customer purchases, handles transactions, and saves purchase history for reporting purposes.

Sales.sales_db.connect_to_db()[source]¶

Connect to the SQLite database.

Returns:

A connection object to interact with the database.

Return type:

sqlite3.Connection

Sales.sales_db.create_purchase_history_table()[source]¶

Create the ‘PurchaseHistory’ table if it does not exist.

This table stores details of purchases made by users, including: - id: Unique identifier for each purchase record. - username: The username of the customer making the purchase. - good_name: The name of the purchased item. - quantity: The number of items purchased. - total_cost: The total cost of the purchase. - purchase_date: The timestamp of the purchase.

Sales.sales_db.save_purchase_history(username, good_name, quantity, total_cost)[source]¶

Save a purchase record to the ‘PurchaseHistory’ table.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the customer making the purchase.

  • good_name (str) – The name of the purchased item.

  • quantity (int) – The number of items purchased.

  • total_cost (float) – The total cost of the purchase.

Raises:

sqlite3.Error – If there is an error during the database operation.

Example

save_purchase_history(“john_doe”, “Laptop”, 1, 1500.0)

Wishlist.wishlist_db.add_to_wishlist(customer_id, product_id)[source]¶

Adds a product to a customer’s wishlist.

Parameters:

  • customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer.

  • product_id (int) – The ID of the product.

Wishlist.wishlist_db.create_wishlist_table()[source]¶

Creates the Wishlist table in the SQLite database if it doesn’t exist.

The Wishlist table tracks products added to a customer’s wishlist.

Wishlist.wishlist_db.get_wishlist(customer_id)[source]¶

Retrieves all products in a customer’s wishlist.

Parameters:

customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer.

Returns:

A list of wishlist items, including product details and the date added.

Return type:

list of tuples

Removes a product from a customer’s wishlist.

Parameters:

  • customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer.

  • product_id (int) – The ID of the product.
